alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 7:35AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Very Light Snow Possible Across the Higher Elevations of northeast Alabama and southern middle Tennessee This Morning... Rain will mix with snow or briefly transition to all snow this morning across portions of southern middle Tennessee and northeast Alabama. A light accumulation of snow will be possible on grassy surfaces and elevated objects, mainly for locations above 1000 feet. This includes ridgetops along the Cumberland Plateau, as well as portions of Lookout Mountain and Sand Mountain. However, due to surface temperatures remaining above the freezing mark, widespread travel problems are not anticipated. Still, please use caution when traveling this morning as roadways are wet from earlier rainfall. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio, or a favorite local media outlet, for further statements or updates from the National Weather Service in Huntsville.
